Q: How to retrieve all Microsoft Defender for Cloud recommendations for a specific Azure resource using PowerShell? A:

Ideally you should be just researching on Az.Security module. The Az.Security module provides Get-AzSecurityAssessment and Get-AzSecuritySubAssessment.


$resourceId = "<FULL-RESOURCE-ID>" #Put the exact resource ID
$assessments = Get-AzSecurityAssessment -AssessedResourceId $resourceId

#This should do the trick
$assessments |
  Select-Object `
    @{n="AssessmentId";e={$_.Id}},
    @{n="DisplayName";e={$_.Properties.DisplayName}},
    @{n="Status";e={$_.Properties.Status.Code}},
    @{n="Severity";e={$_.Properties.Metadata.Severity}},
    @{n="Description";e={$_.Properties.Metadata.Description}} |
  Format-Table -AutoSize

# Or export the full objects to JSON (include deeper nested properties)
$assessments | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 8 | Out-File ./assessments.json

Hope it helps. However, you should post your piece of code or what have you tried so far so that people can offer help in a better way

Q: How to rename many files with a ID_suffix name to prefix_ID? A:

To rename multiple files from "name_ID.ext" (suffix) to "ID_name.ext" (prefix), use this simple command in Terminal (Linux/Mac) or PowerShell (Windows).

Assume files like "photo_123.jpg" → "123_photo.jpg".

Run this bash one-liner:

Bash

for file in *_*; do mv "$file" "${file##*_}_${file%_*}.${file##*.}"; done

Or use rename tool:

Bash

rename 's/(.*)_(.*)\.(.*)$/ $2_$1.$3/' *_*
